code: @Manual{,   title = {unrtf: Extract Text from Rich Text Format (RTF) Documents},   author = {Jeroen Ooms},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.4.5},   url = {https://docs.ropensci.org/unrtf/ https://ropensci.r-universe.dev/unrtf}, }

what: Extract Text from Rich Text Format (RTF) Documents
title: Extract Text from Rich Text Format (RTF) Documents
text: Extract Text Rich Text Format (rtf) Documents Wraps unrtf utility extract text rtf files.

title: Extract Text from Rich Text Format (RTF) Documents
Extract Text from Rich Text Format (RTF) Documents
text: function single function unrtf(). takes either local file path URL word document:
code: library(unrtf) text <- unrtf("https://jeroen.github.io/files/sample.rtf", format = "text") html <- unrtf("https://jeroen.github.io/files/sample.rtf", format = "html") cat(text) ###  Translation from RTF performed by UnRTF, version 0.21.9  ### font table contains 11 fonts total  TITLE: It is an example test rtf-file to RTF2XML bean for testing  AUTHOR: kissj ### creation date: 17 April 2000 15:34  ### revision date: 19 April 2000 09:34  ### total pages: 2 ### total words: 217 ### total chars: 1240  ----------------- It is an example test rtf-file to RTF2XML bean for testing  Font size 10, plain text; Font size 12, bold text. Underline,bold text.  Underline,italic,bold text.  Font size 22, plain text.  Bold text.

title: Convert rtf Documents — unrtf
text: Converts rtf document html, text latex. Output html recommended unrtf limited support converting character encodings problematic non-ascii text.

title: Convert rtf Documents — unrtf
code: unrtf(file = NULL, format = c("html", "text", "latex"), verbose = FALSE,   conf_dir = NULL)

title: Convert rtf Documents — unrtf
text: file path url 'rtf' file format output format, must "text", "html" "latex" verbose print output stderr conf_dir use custom dir .conf files serve output templates.

title: Convert rtf Documents — unrtf
text: Output can customized via set .conf files serve templates various formats. default conf files located system.file("share", package = "unrtf") modify output, copy files custom location set pass directory conf_dir argument unrtf.

title: Convert rtf Documents — unrtf
code: library(unrtf) text <- unrtf("https://jeroen.github.io/files/sample.rtf", format = "text") html <- unrtf("https://jeroen.github.io/files/sample.rtf", format = "html") cat(text) #> ###  Translation from RTF performed by UnRTF, version 0.21.9  #> ### font table contains 11 fonts total #>  #> TITLE: It is an example test rtf-file to RTF2XML bean for testing #>  #> AUTHOR: kissj #> ### creation date: 17 April 2000 15:34  #> ### revision date: 19 April 2000 09:34  #> ### total pages: 2 #> ### total words: 217 #> ### total chars: 1240 #>  #> ----------------- #> It is an example test rtf-file to RTF2XML bean for testing #>  #> Font size 10, plain text; #> Font size 12, bold text. Underline,bold text. #>  Underline,italic,bold text.  #> Font size 22, plain text. #>  Bold text. #>          #>          #>          #>  Italic text. #>  #>  Simple table : #>  #>  #>  #> 	1st column	2nd column	3rd column	4th column	5th column	 #> 	1.1 item	1.2 item	1.3 item	1.4 item	1.5 item	 #> 	2.1 item	2.2 item	2.3 item	2.4 item	2.5 item	 #> 	3.1 item	3.2 item	3.3 item	3.4 item	3.5 item	 #> 	4.1 item	4.2 item	4.3 item	4.4 item	4.5 item	 #> 	5.1 item	5.2 item	5.3 item	5.4 item	5.5 item	 #> 	Empty 	&&	&		Empty	 #> 	Last items&	&	&		Last items	 #>  #>  #>  #> List : #>  #> "         #> It is the 1st row of the list #> "         #> It is the 2nd row of the list #> "         #> & #> "         #> & #> "         #> & #> "         #> It is the last row of the list #>  #>  Here is a brief Courier text. #>  Here is a brief MS Sans - Serif text. #>  Here is a brief MS Serif text. #>  Here is a brief Times New Roman text. #>  #>   #>  #>  Some paragraphs : #>  #> I.       #> Align left : #>  #>  The text you are reading is aligned left. It is an align  left text. It is also an align  left sentence.  #>   #> II.      #> Align right: #>  #>  The text you are reading is aligned right. It is an align  right text. It is also an align  right sentence.  #>  #> III.     #> Align centered: #>  #>  The text you are reading is aligned center. It is an align  centered text. It is also an align  centered sentence.  #>  #> IV.      #> Align justified: #>  #>  The text you are reading is aligned justify. It is an align  justified text. It is also an align  justified sentence. #>  #> Here are some special characters: öt árvíztqrQ ütvefúrógép, which means five flood resistant hammer drills (J) in Hungarian. #>  #>  At last you can see an image : #>  #> ### Drawn Shape (ignored-not implemented yet) #>  #>
